hero.headline: Freelance Developer for Hire
hero.description: I'm Max, a full-stack developer based in Poland. I build websites, e-commerce stores, web apps, and SaaS products. I handle everything — from research and prototyping to deployment. UK and US clients welcome.

about.headline: Why Work With Me?
about.subheadline: I don't just code what you ask for—I help figure out what actually needs to be built first.
about.description: Most developers jump straight into development. I spend time understanding the problem: what the site or app needs to achieve, who it's for, and how competitors approach it. Then I prototype, plan scope, and build something that actually solves the problem.
about.description2: You work directly with me—not an agency team that hands off between designers, developers, and project managers. One person. Full ownership. From research through deployment. That means faster decisions, clearer communication, and code that reflects what you actually need.
trustBadges: Working with Teams in Poland, UK & US

hero.title: Production web software. No templates. No WordPress.
hero.subtitle: I build production web apps with React and Next.js—not prototypes, not templates. One developer. Full stack. Real code.

cards.title: E-Commerce & Online Stores
cards.description: I build custom e-commerce platforms using React and Next.js with Stripe or PayPal payments, inventory control, and order management. Ideal for businesses that have outgrown Shopify or need full control over their store logic.

cards.title: SaaS & Web Applications
cards.description: Custom web applications with authentication, dashboards, APIs, and real user workflows. Built for production from day one—handling data, permissions, payments, and integrations without duct-tape solutions or prototype shortcuts.

cards.title: Full-Stack Web Development
cards.description: I build fast, modern business websites with React, Next.js, and TypeScript. No page builders, no templates—just clean code that loads quickly, scales well, and is easy to maintain as your business grows.

cards.title: SEO & Performance Optimization
cards.description: Technical SEO optimization focused on speed, structure, and search visibility. I improve Core Web Vitals, fix rendering and indexing issues, and make sure your site is fast, crawlable, and built the way Google expects.

cards.title: AI Integration
cards.description: I integrate AI features into your product: email automation, document processing, intelligent search, custom workflows. Built with production-ready APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google), not proof-of-concepts.

process.title: How I Build Your Software
process.subtitle: A proven workflow for building SaaS applications, e-commerce platforms, and AI-powered features that scale—not prototypes or WordPress templates.

steps.title: Requirements & Architecture
steps.subtitle: Technical Discovery
steps.description: I analyze your business requirements, select the optimal React and Next.js stack, and design database architecture and API structure for scalability.

steps.title: Development & Integration
steps.subtitle: Build & Test
steps.description: I write production TypeScript code, implement features with real-time updates and authentication, test continuously, and integrate AI capabilities where needed.

steps.title: Production Deployment
steps.subtitle: Deploy & Document
steps.description: I deploy to production infrastructure, optimize performance and SEO, provide complete documentation, and train your team on maintenance.

items.question: How much does a website cost?
items.answer: Website costs vary based on complexity. A simple landing page starts from $500, while custom web applications can range from $2,000-$10,000+. Contact me for a free, detailed quote.

items.question: How long does it take to build a website?
items.answer: A simple website takes 1-2 weeks, while complex applications can take 4-8 weeks. I provide realistic timelines upfront and keep you updated throughout the process.

items.question: Do you work with international clients?
items.answer: Yes! I work with clients from Poland, UK, US, Germany, and across Europe. I'm fluent in English and Polish, and I'm available for calls in multiple timezones.

items.question: What technologies do you use?
items.answer: I specialize in React, Next.js, Node.js, TypeScript, and modern CSS frameworks like Tailwind. For databases, I use PostgreSQL and MongoDB depending on project needs.

items.question: Do you offer SEO services?
items.answer: Yes, all my websites are built with SEO best practices. I also offer dedicated SEO optimization services including technical audits, on-page optimization, and local SEO.

items.question: How long does a typical project take?
items.answer: Small projects: 3-5 weeks. SaaS or e-commerce platforms: 8-12 weeks, depending on scope and integrations.

items.question: What's your pricing structure?
items.answer: Fixed-price for defined scopes, or monthly retainer for ongoing development. Pricing depends on complexity and required integrations.

items.question: Do you offer ongoing maintenance?
items.answer: Yes. I provide ongoing support, updates, and performance improvements after launch, usually as a monthly maintenance or development agreement.

schema.description: Full-stack web developer based in Poland specializing in React, Next.js, and TypeScript. Building websites, e-commerce, and web applications.

aboutPage.heading: About Max Mendes
bio: I'm Max, a full-stack web developer based in Częstochowa, Poland. I build modern business websites, e-commerce stores, and AI-powered web applications for companies that need more than a basic template. My work focuses on clean, maintainable code, strong performance, and real-world usability.

I'm not a designer or a branding specialist. I don't create logos or visual identities from scratch. My role is technical: I write code and turn ideas into working products. I implement interfaces using proven UI patterns and component libraries like shadcn/ui and Tailwind CSS, with a strong focus on speed, SEO optimization, and scalability. I also integrate AI capabilities using OpenAI and Anthropic APIs—tools I've used in production to build features like smart content generation, automated workflows, and intelligent data processing.

My process is structured and practical. I start with research—understanding the business goal, competitors, and technical requirements. Then I create low-fidelity prototypes in Figma to map user flows and features. After that, I build production-ready code using React and Next.js, handle deployment, optimization, and iteration based on feedback.

My biggest project, FlowMate, is an AI-powered email management platform that handles multi-platform broadcasting and smart content generation. It took 300+ hours to build and taught me how to architect production SaaS applications with authentication, payments, AI integration, and real user data at scale.

I'm available for Polish businesses that need modern business websites or e-commerce stores, as well as UK and US companies looking for a full-stack developer. I'm fluent in English and work comfortably across time zones.

items.description: Based in Częstochowa, Poland, I moved into freelance development after a year of self-study in React, Next.js, and TypeScript. I build production web products—websites, SaaS, e-commerce—with code, not templates. FlowMate (my first full SaaS, 300+ hours) set how I approach client work: own the entire stack, ship real products.

160 hours/month analyzing systems and translating business requirements into technical solutions. This role taught me how businesses actually use software—skills that directly feed my development work. It's a constant loop: understand constraints, build solutions that fit reality.

cta.title: Now you know enough to decide.

You get clear decisions, fast feedback, and products built with intent—not feature bloat. This works for Polish businesses and international teams who value clarity over bureaucracy.

services.title: Full-Stack Web Development

Projects here are treated like real products, with clean structure and long-term use in mind. Everything runs on a modern stack using React, Next.js, and TypeScript, so performance and speed are built in from day one.

services.description: Slow pages and messy structure quietly hurt results. This work is about making sites load faster, feel smoother, and make more sense to search engines. You end up with better visibility, better user experience, and fewer technical issues down the road.

services.description: Smart features powered by AI language models. I integrate AI into your product where it actually helps—handling support questions, generating content, or automating workflows that waste your team's time.

Content generation and summarization inside your app or admin panel

Custom AI features designed for your specific business needs

schema.description: Frequently asked questions about web development services, pricing, timelines, and technical details.

faqPage.intro: How we work together, what to expect, and what happens after launch.

items.question: What services do you provide?
items.answer: I build production web applications: business websites, SaaS platforms, custom e-commerce systems, and AI-powered features. Everything is built with React, Next.js, and TypeScript—production-ready from day one, not demos or prototypes.

items.question: What don't you build?
items.answer: I don't build WordPress sites, page-builder websites, or design-only projects. I also don't offer branding, visual identity, or marketing services. My work is software development—writing real code that scales.

items.question: Do you work solo or with a team?
items.answer: I work as a solo full-stack developer and handle the entire build myself. No handoffs, no project managers, no communication gaps. You work directly with the person writing your code.

items.question: Can you handle both Polish and international clients?
items.answer: Yes. I work with companies in Poland and international clients in the UK and US. Communication is in English or Polish, and Polish content is reviewed with my wife to ensure natural language and accuracy.

items.question: How do we start working together?
items.answer: We start with a conversation about your problem and goals. I review the requirements, ask technical questions, and propose a clear scope, timeline, and pricing before any work begins.
items.linkText: Get in touch to discuss your project

items.question: What's your development process?
items.answer: I start by defining requirements and technical architecture, then move into iterative development with regular checkpoints. Features are built and tested as we go, with adjustments based on your feedback.

items.question: How long does a typical project take?
items.answer: Simple business websites take 3-5 weeks. SaaS platforms or custom e-commerce systems typically take 8-12 weeks, depending on integrations, database complexity, and feature requirements.

items.question: How do we communicate during the project?
items.answer: Direct communication via email, Slack, or calls—whatever works for you. Weekly check-ins keep you updated on progress, blockers, and next steps. No unnecessary meetings or status reports.

items.question: What's your pricing structure?
items.answer: Most projects are fixed-price based on a clearly defined scope. For ongoing development or evolving products, I offer monthly development retainers.

items.question: Do you require a deposit?
items.answer: Yes. Projects start with a 30-50% deposit, with the remainder paid in milestones or at delivery. This keeps timelines predictable and protects both sides.

items.question: What payment methods do you accept?
items.answer: I accept bank transfers (SWIFT/SEPA for international clients) and online payment platforms. All transactions are straightforward and compliant with EU regulations.

items.question: Can I pay in installments?
items.answer: Yes, for larger projects. Payments are split into clear milestones tied to delivered work, so you're paying for real progress.

items.question: What tech stack do you use?
items.answer: React, Next.js, and TypeScript for frontend and full-stack applications. PostgreSQL or Supabase for databases, with additional tools based on your specific requirements. This stack delivers fast, secure, maintainable software that scales without major rewrites.

items.question: Can you work with my existing codebase?
items.answer: Yes, if the codebase is reasonably maintained and documented. I'll review it first and tell you honestly whether it makes sense to extend it, refactor parts, or start fresh.

items.question: Do you handle hosting and deployment?
items.answer: Yes. I handle production deployment, environment configuration, and performance optimization. Your application launches stable, monitored, and ready for real users—not just pushed live and forgotten.

items.question: How do you ensure my site is secure and performant?
items.answer: I follow modern security practices for authentication and data handling. Server-side rendering, optimized images, and proper caching are built in by default. Core Web Vitals and load times are treated as requirements, not extras.

items.question: What happens after the project launches?
items.answer: I monitor stability after launch, fix any early issues, and ensure everything works as expected. You're not left alone with a fresh deployment.

items.question: Do you offer ongoing maintenance?
items.answer: Yes. I offer maintenance and development plans covering updates, bug fixes, performance improvements, and new features as your product evolves.

items.question: Can you train my team to manage the site?
items.answer: Yes. I provide documentation and walkthroughs so your team understands the system and can manage content or basic operations confidently.

items.question: What if I need new features later?
items.answer: New features can be added as separate projects or as part of a maintenance agreement. Clean code means extending functionality is usually straightforward and predictable.

cta.title: Didn't find your answer here?
cta.description: Drop me an email or give me a call—I'll give you a straight answer about your project, no sales pitch.
